DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : An internet-based health behavior program provide information physical activity , fitness , nutrition may help participant become healthy reduce risk develop cancer . PURPOSE : This randomized clinical trial study individualize internet-based health behavior program see well work compare standard internet-based health behavior program prevent cancer improve physical activity , fitness , nutrition participant physically inactive high body mass index .
DOC.brief_title: An Individualized Internet-Based Health Behavior Program Standard Internet-Based Health Behavior Program Preventing Cancer Improving Physical Activity Nutrition Participants Who Are Physically Inactive With Higher Body Mass Index
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Compare efficacy internet-based mastery-model health behavior educational intervention v internet-based standard care health behavior educational intervention improve physical activity nutrition sedentary participant higher body mass index . - Compare efficacy intervention reduce cancer risk , participant . OUTLINE : This randomize , control , multicenter study . Participants stratify accord participate site , age ( 55 year vs 55 year ) , gender , ethnic group , aerobic capacity ( ≤ 6 metabolic equivalent task [ METS ] v > 6 METS ) . Participants randomize 1 2 intervention arm . - Arm I ( mastery model health behavior educational intervention ) : Participants log Guide Health Project ( GTH ) website weekly provide access 24-month period healthy lifestyle coaching module completely individualized fitness program organize accord mastery-model health behavior educational intervention . The mastery-model intervention comprise 6-month behavioral initiation phase include orientation refinement goal expectation content area ; 6-month behavioral establishment phase comprise healthy lifestyle coaching module focus physical activity nutrition least week ; 6-month behavioral maintenance phase comprise taper frequency coach session month . - Arm II ( standard care health behavior educational intervention ) : Participants log GTH website weekly provide access 24-month period information regard healthy lifestyle focus physical activity nutrition organize accord standard care health behavior educational intervention . In arm , participant verify step-counts measure pedometer complete Block Food Frequency Questionnaire online 10 18 month . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 300 participant ( 150 per arm ) accrue study within 1 year .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Sedentary participant Not currently participate regular exercise program ( i.e. , < 30 minutes/day moderate physical activity , 5 day week ) Body Mass Index 2333.5 Patiwnts meet follow criterion exclude : High blood pressure ( BP ) ( i.e. , systolic BP ≥ 140 mm Hg OR diastolic BP ≥ 90 mm Hg ) OR BP control medication betablockers Known high cholesterol ( i.e. , > 200 mg/dL ) Known low highdensity lipoprotein level ( i.e. , < 40 mg/dL ) Use antihyperlipidemic medication Existing disease ( i.e. , heart disease , cancer , diabetes , kidney liver problem ) PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age 18 63 Performance status Not specify Life expectancy Not specify Hematopoietic Not specify Hepatic No known liver disease Renal No known kidney disease Cardiovascular See Disease Characteristics No know cardiovascular disease Blood pressure ≤ 140/90 mm Hg Pulmonary No known pulmonary disease Other Not pregnant No known diabetes No known HIV positivity No cancer within past 5 year No condition ( e.g. , orthopedic injury musculoskeletal disability ) would restrict physical activity ability take 1mile walk test No known lifethreatening illness condition Internet user PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy Not specify Chemotherapy Not specify Endocrine therapy Not specify Radiotherapy Not specify Surgery No prior organ transplantation Other No concurrent betablockers
DOC.keyword: unspecified adult solid tumor , protocol specific
